name: Jacobson radical
rephrased: The Jacobson radical is the set of elements in a ring that annihilate all simple modules, and it is the same whether considering left or right modules.
solved_by: The nilpotency of the Jacobson radical for commutative rings was proven by Nathan Smale, while the general nilpotency conjecture was disproven by Irving Herstein and Derek Henry Faddeev Montgomery.
explained: In mathematics, more specifically ring theory, the Jacobson radical of a ring R is the ideal consisting of those elements in R that annihilate all simple right R-modules. It happens that substituting 'left' in place of 'right' in the definition yields the same ideal, and so the notion is leftâ€“right symmetric.
